citation.article-title: Recharacterization and emended description of the genus Mycoplana and description of two new species Mycoplana ramosa and Mycoplana segnis.

p.s: Emended description of Mycoplana bullata Gray and Thornton 1928.

Reduction of nitrate is weak or negative. The Voges-Proskauer test is positive. Catalase activity is weak or negative. Acid is produced from D-glucose oxidatively , but is not produced from D-arabinose, D-xylose, D-mannose, D-fructose, D-galactose, maltose, sucrose, lactose, trehalose, D-sorbitol, D-mannitol, inositol, glycerol, and soluble starch. Calcium pantothenate is required for growth. The utilization of single carbon compounds and nitrogen compounds cannot be determined at this time, possibly because of axotrophy. The DNA base composition ranges from 66 to 68 mol% G+C. The major hydroxy fatty acid is 3-hydroxy-C12:0 acid.
The type strain is strain TK0051 (= ATCC 4278 = IFO 13290), which was isolated from soil by Gray and Thornton in 1928.
The DNA base composition of the type strain is 66.7 mol% G+C.
Isolate TKO065 is also an M. bullata strain.
